programme.desc: You Only Move Twice: Homer is offered a new job by mysterious businessman Hank Scorpio. But will Marge, Bart and Lisa be happy in their idyllic new home town?

programme.title: The Simpsons: Homer's Day
programme.desc: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner: Homer becomes a restaurant critic for the Springfield Shopper, and ends up so feared that the town's restaurateurs plot to kill him.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Homer's Day
programme.desc: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt): The Simpsons are forced to flee to the countryside, where Homer accidentally invents highly addictive tomacco. But the animals like it too...

programme.title: The Simpsons: Homer's Day
programme.desc: Homer's Phobia: Homer's preconceptions surface when Bart befriends a gay shop owner (guest star John Waters), and he decides to take Bart hunting, but it doesn't go to plan.

programme.desc: Fresh singletons visit the restaurant and some favourite daters return for a special episode celebrating Fred and his team's successes, engagements and the first First Dates baby!

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: First Days: Claire arrives for her first day at Jay's company but is worried that Jay doesn't have a real job for her. And Cam is now substitute teaching at the high school.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: One resident's tragic fate is revealed, and Liberty is shattered by hidden truths. Clare's devastated when a child goes missing, Grace wrestles with guilt, and will Jez's secrets spill out?

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. Stopping at iconic football grounds, Sam gets a boost from famous faces as he battles blisters, exhaustion and the elements for charity

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. Stopping at iconic football grounds, Sam gets a boost from famous faces as he battles blisters, exhaustion and the elements for charity

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Riddiculous for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Ranvir Singh hosts a charity edition, with former England goalkeeper David James, TV and radio presenter Rickie Haywood-Williams and comedian Maisie Adam joining previous champions Ilana, Jessica and Maxine to take on the Riddlemaster to raise money for Unicef

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon 2
programme.desc: Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler and Cate Blanchett. After five years during which time the Vikings and dragons have learned to live together, Hiccup discovers there's a threat to that peaceful status quo that needs to be faced.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by the Rev Richard Coles to try falconry, while hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform Liza Raby, who has raised more than £170,000 for charity. Manisha Morgan is on hand to make some tasty treats

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by author and screenwriter Anthony Horowitz, Dragons' Den star Deborah Meaden and broadcaster and The One Show host Alex Jones. David Domoney has tips to brighten up patios in time for summer, drinks expert Becky Paskin is in charge of refreshments with tea-infused tipples, Lesley Joseph introduces us to the shy blue shark, we get a look at some new arrivals as the lambing season comes to an end

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the latest colour and seasonal highlights from his plot, Giovanna Fletcher invites viewers into her own patch for the first time, and Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a beautifully designed Italian-inspired space

programme.title: The Royal Procession at Ascot: Celebrating 200 Years
programme.desc: Alice Loxton celebrates the history and heritage of the opening to the Royal Ascot meeting, exploring why it remains so popular and important to this day. The programme also hears from those who have experienced being in the procession first-hand and showcase some never-before-seen footage of key moments

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Can Stefan from Huddersfield, Janet from Bridgwater, Alex from Manchester and Caron from London work together as a team and take down one of the country's finest quiz brains? Bradley Walsh hosts as they try to beat the Chaser for thousands of pounds

programme.title: Diamonds Are Forever
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. When it is discovered that large amounts of diamonds are being smuggled out of South Africa, James Bond is sent to investigate and comes up against an old enemy.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: Soccer Aid for Unicef 2025
programme.desc: England v Soccer Aid World XI (Kick-off 7.30pm). Dermot O'Leary and Alex Scott host the pre-match build-up before presenting live coverage of the charity match from Old Trafford, the home of Manchester United. This year's star-studded line-up includes Tyson Fury, Wayne Rooney, Gary Neville, Vicki McClure, Mo Farah, Harry Redknapp, Tom Grennan, Denise Lewis, Jill Scott, Nadia Nadim and many more famous faces playing in aid of Unicef

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: America's Veterans - The War Within
programme.desc: Deeyah Khan's film explores the devastating psychological aftermath of serving in the military in wartime. Travelling from Alabama to Washington, she speaks to veterans of America's War on Terror about their combat experiences, including accounts of violence unleashed on civilians in Iraq and Afghanistan. Part of the Exposure strand, the film explores the dehumanising effects of war and its long-term social impact on America and beyond

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Madonna, Lee Evans, Jennifer Hudson, Perrie Edwards, Liam Gallagher, Richard Gere, Lily Allen, Frank Skinner and Johannes Radebe

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Donington Park with racing from The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE and the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined in Hong Kong by fellow chef and friend Simon Rimmer as they step into the kitchen to put their own spin on an indulgent prawn toast sandwich, tour the city's old town, and make a pit stop at the city's oldest noodle factory. Jeremy also takes Simon to the hills on a morning cycle ride that is followed by a beachside barbecue where they cook vegetables, chicken wings and pork using Jeremy's secret sauce

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Jason Williams heads to the Malvern Spring Festival for a behind-the-scenes look at this year's stand-out gardens, while Alan shares the latest seasonal highlights from his own plot. Camilla Bassett-Smith travels to the Scottish hills to explore a beautifully preserved Japanese garden with a rich family history, Martha Swales offers a step-by-step guide to creating a wildlife pond, and Helen Cross shares practical ways to get children into gardening

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Rotherham housemates Craig and Steve, married couple Angela and Mike from Bridgend, and sisters Laura and Mollie from Leeds use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Amitabh, originally from Delhi, Becky from Birmingham, Derek from London and Fiona from Oldham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Victoria is disappointed, Bear has some good news, and Aaron might change his mind

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody gets on the wrong side of Lisa, Sally wants to share her concerns with social services, Lou denies reporting Maria to the police, Daniel makes a suggestion to Dee-Dee, and Sean shows Todd a picture of Theo on a dating app

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts as another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: The Royal Procession at Ascot: Celebrating 200 Years

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie arrives at Tovey and Anton's wedding alone, where she covers for Joe and continues to lie - even when presented with evidence. Edged closer to the singles table, Birdie goes through the motions of speeches, before lashing out at Margeaux

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Dermot O'Leary's Taste of Ireland
programme.desc: The TV and radio presenter goes back to his family roots on a gastronomic tour to discover the island of Ireland's best kept culinary secrets, beginning in Co Wexford. He tries his hand at picking strawberries, Wexford's most famous produce, before learning how to make crab linguine in his parents' favourite restaurant. Dermot then heads to a dairy farm to make butter, before playing hurling with his father and the stars of the local team

programme.title: STV Racing Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of the opening day of the festival, including the 2.30 Queen Anne Stakes and 4.20 St James' Palace Stakes, plus races at 3.05, 3.40, 5.00 and 5.35. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Robert is devastated, John is furious, and Aaron is determined

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Museum of the Family is packed with visitors to see a collection of miniature doll's houses donated by a real estate mogul - only for the businessman to be shot dead in front of the crowd. Barnaby's investigation uncovers evidence of unsafe living conditions for the victim's tenants that would have given plenty of people a reason to kill - as well as a mysterious death that a man was imprisoned for, despite protesting his innocence.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Cold Feet stars Fay Ripley and Hermione Norris trace their ancestry. Fay discovers just how deeply showbusiness runs in her blood as well as her ancestors being the King's own card-makers. Hermione learns about her two-times great-grandmother who supported her whole family with her dressmaking business

programme.title: Fake
programme.desc: Birdie pulls herself together and starts investigating Joe, talking to his ex-business partners, brothers and the infamous Tessa Rain who all have their own stories of him. When Allan appears at her office she realises that she was simply a pawn in a much larger scam

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. Stopping at iconic football grounds, Sam gets a boost from famous faces as he battles blisters, exhaustion and the elements for charity

programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes to examine the appeal of ITV detective drama Vera as it comes to an end after 13 years. Brenda Blethyn reflects on her time as DCI Vera Stanhope, and talks about the camaraderie and joy of working on the show. Featuring interviews from key cast members - David Leon (DS Joe Ashworth), Jon Morrison (DC Kenny Lockhart), the directors, crew, and author Ann Cleeves, Vera's creator

programme.title: Sam Thompson's Match Ball Mission for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by author and screenwriter Anthony Horowitz, Dragons' Den star Deborah Meaden and broadcaster and The One Show host Alex Jones. David Domoney has tips to brighten up patios in time for summer, drinks expert Becky Paskin is in charge of refreshments with tea-infused tipples, Lesley Joseph introduces us to the shy blue shark, we get a look at some new arrivals as the lambing season comes to an end

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan showcases the latest colour and seasonal highlights from his plot, Giovanna Fletcher invites viewers into her own patch for the first time, and Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a beautifully designed Italian-inspired space

programme.desc: Alice Loxton celebrates the history and heritage of the opening to the Royal Ascot meeting, exploring why it remains so popular and important to this day. programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: Diamonds Are Forever
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery. When it is discovered that large amounts of diamonds are being smuggled out of South Africa, James Bond is sent to investigate and comes up against an old enemy.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Deal or No Deal for Soccer Aid
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special charity edition as The Last Leg co-host Alex Brooker goes up against the infamous Banker, supported on the wings by his Soccer Aid family. Can Alex choose the right boxes and resist the tempting cash offers until just the right moment to bag a huge cash prize for Unicef?

programme.title: Soccer Aid for Unicef 2025
programme.desc: England v Soccer Aid World XI (Kick-off 7.30pm). Dermot O'Leary and Alex Scott host the pre-match build-up before presenting live coverage of the charity match from Old Trafford, the home of Manchester United. This year's star-studded line-up includes Tyson Fury, Wayne Rooney, Gary Neville, Vicki McClure, Mo Farah, Harry Redknapp, Tom Grennan, Denise Lewis, Jill Scott, Nadia Nadim and many more famous faces playing in aid of Unicef

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: America's Veterans - The War Within
programme.desc: Deeyah Khan's film explores the devastating psychological aftermath of serving in the military in wartime. Travelling from Alabama to Washington, she speaks to veterans of America's War on Terror about their combat experiences, including accounts of violence unleashed on civilians in Iraq and Afghanistan. Part of the Exposure strand, the film explores the dehumanising effects of war and its long-term social impact on America and beyond

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Madonna, Lee Evans, Jennifer Hudson, Perrie Edwards, Liam Gallagher, Richard Gere, Lily Allen, Frank Skinner and Johannes Radebe

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Donington Park with racing from The Vertu MINI CHALLENGE and the Porsche Sprint Challenge Great Britain.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined in Hong Kong by fellow chef and friend Simon Rimmer as they step into the kitchen to put their own spin on an indulgent prawn toast sandwich, tour the city's old town, and make a pit stop at the city's oldest noodle factory. Jeremy also takes Simon to the hills on a morning cycle ride that is followed by a beachside barbecue where they cook vegetables, chicken wings and pork using Jeremy's secret sauce

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Jason Williams heads to the Malvern Spring Festival for a behind-the-scenes look at this year's stand-out gardens, while Alan shares the latest seasonal highlights from his own plot. Camilla Bassett-Smith travels to the Scottish hills to explore a beautifully preserved Japanese garden with a rich family history, Martha Swales offers a step-by-step guide to creating a wildlife pond, and Helen Cross shares practical ways to get children into gardening

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Rotherham housemates Craig and Steve, married couple Angela and Mike from Bridgend, and sisters Laura and Mollie from Leeds use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Amitabh, originally from Delhi, Becky from Birmingham, Derek from London and Fiona from Oldham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Victoria is disappointed, Bear has some good news, and Aaron might change his mind

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Brody gets on the wrong side of Lisa, Sally wants to share her concerns with social services, Lou denies reporting Maria to the police, Daniel makes a suggestion to Dee-Dee, and Sean shows Todd a picture of Theo on a dating app

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Sam embarks on a 260-mile challenge to deliver the Soccer Aid for Unicef match ball from Stamford Bridge in London to Old Trafford in Manchester, the home of the 2025 match. The nationwide challenge sees him take on five back-to-back endurance days, running a total of five marathons and cycling over 130 miles. programme.title: Vera, Farewell Pet

programme.title: America's Veterans - The War Within
programme.desc: Deeyah Khan's film explores the devastating psychological aftermath of serving in the military in wartime. Travelling from Alabama to Washington, she speaks to veterans of America's War on Terror about their combat experiences, including accounts of violence unleashed on civilians in Iraq and Afghanistan. Part of the Exposure strand, the film explores the dehumanising effects of war and its long-term social impact on America and beyond

programme.title: Shardlake
programme.desc: Dark deeds are perpetrated in a 16th-century English monastery in a four-part thriller adapted by screenwriter Stephen Butchard from the first book in CJ Sansom's series of novels. Idealistic lawyer Matthew Shardlake (Arthur Hughes) works for Thomas Cromwell (Sean Bean) and is dedicated to serving justice and the Crown. He is flanked by cocky assistant Jack Barak (Anthony Boyle), who could be a spy for Cromwell. Shardlake is living with scoliosis and is rudely dismissed as a 'crookback' by Tudor society as he carries out his duties. Weathering the verbal abuse, Shardlake and Barak travel to the remote town of Scarnsea to investigate the murder of a commissioner, who was gathering evidence for Cromwell to close the local monastery. The duo are met with hostility and suspicion as they seek answers from Abbot Fabian (Babou Ceesay) and a secretive brotherhood including Edwig (David Pearse), Gabriel (Miles Barrow), Guy (Irfan Shamji), Jerome (Paul Kaye) and Mortimus (Brian Vernel)
